p: In the full‐forcing run, we found no significant trend in modeled global NBP for the PILM (850‐1849), but large anomalies (see section 3.3 for more analysis) were associated with major volcanic eruptions (e.g., Samalas in Indonesia in 1258, Kuwae of Vanuatu in 1452, and Tambora in Indonesia in 1815; Figures 1a– 1c). Over the industrial period (1850‐2005), the modeled NBP, NPP, and RH show significant increasing trends, accelerating after the 1950s (Figure 1).
